name: standouts_title_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title, plot
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title, plot for every movie.

Identify movies that stand out from the rest in genre, tone, or theme, as they can impact perceived diversity of the list.  
A list of movies with similar features may feel more diverse if it includes one or more outliers.  

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Snatch (2000)
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a diverse range of genres and tones. It includes action thrillers (Bourne Identity, Bourne Supremacy, Snatch), science fiction (Jurassic Park, Guardians of the Galaxy 2), a horror film (The Others), a biographical drama (A Beautiful Mind), and a dystopian young adult adventure (The Hunger Games).  The inclusion of Jurassic Park as a more family-friendly adventure film further broadens the appeal and diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a mix of genres, but with a slightly more consistent tone than List A.  It features science fiction (Guardians of the Galaxy 2), a biographical crime drama (Catch Me If You Can), a horror film (The Others), a coming-of-age story (Moonrise Kingdom), a dramedy (Rain Man), a superhero film (The Avengers), a musical comedy (School of Rock), and a war film (Inglourious Basterds). While diverse, the films share a more consistent level of lightheartedness or quirky humor, except for Inglourious Basterds.
response.list_C_description: List C is similar to List A in its genre diversity, including action thrillers (Bourne Identity, Bourne Supremacy), science fiction (Guardians of the Galaxy 2), horror (The Others), coming-of-age (Moonrise Kingdom), science fiction action (Edge of Tomorrow), science fiction disaster (War of the Worlds), and dramedy (Rain Man).  The inclusion of War of the Worlds adds a more serious and apocalyptic tone compared to the other films.
response.comparison: Lists A and C exhibit greater genre diversity than List B. List B, while diverse, leans towards a more consistent tone across its films. List A stands out with its inclusion of Jurassic Park, which is significantly different in tone and target audience compared to the other films. List C includes War of the Worlds, which adds a darker and more serious element to the mix.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A is the most diverse because it offers the widest range of genres and tones. The inclusion of Jurassic Park as a family-friendly adventure film acts as a significant outlier, contrasting sharply with the action thrillers and darker dramas. This contrast enhances the overall diversity of the list more effectively than the other lists.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety. It includes war (Saving Private Ryan), psychological thriller (Fight Club), animation (Up), biographical drama (Spotlight), animated family film (Finding Dory), fantasy adventure (Pirates of the Caribbean), science fiction thriller (Ex Machina), and crime (Goodfellas).  The inclusion of animation and family films alongside darker, more mature themes provides contrast.
response.list_B_description: List B has a similar range to List A but feels less diverse. While it includes action (Mr. & Mrs. Smith), war (Saving Private Ryan), animation (Monsters, Inc.), science fiction (Ex Machina), psychological thriller (Fight Club), crime (Goodfellas), mystery (Sherlock Holmes), and science fiction (Rogue One), the balance is less striking.  The grouping of action, thriller, and crime feels less diverse than List A's spread.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a mix of war (Saving Private Ryan), action (Mr. & Mrs. Smith), war drama (Hacksaw Ridge), superhero (Avengers: Infinity War), crime (Goodfellas), science fiction (Maze Runner), neo-western crime (Hell or High Water), and science fiction (Rogue One). The inclusion of the neo-western and the very different tone of Hacksaw Ridge adds some diversity, but the grouping of war and action films is still prominent.
response.comparison: All three lists contain some overlap, notably Saving Private Ryan and Goodfellas. List A stands out due to its inclusion of a wider range of genres and tones, including animation and family-friendly films alongside darker and more mature themes. Lists B and C have a more concentrated selection of genres, particularly action and thriller elements.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A offers the most diverse range of genres and tones. The juxtaposition of lighter films like Up and Finding Dory with darker, more intense films like Fight Club and Spotlight creates a more noticeable contrast and a broader appeal.  Lists B and C, while diverse, lack the same level of genre and tonal variation.

response.list_A_description: List A offers a diverse range of genres and tones. It includes animated films (Inside Out), thrillers (Shutter Island, Split), science fiction (The Matrix), dramas (Shawshank Redemption, Requiem for a Dream), crime (Pulp Fiction), and a dramedy (Intouchables).  The emotional range is also broad, from the lightheartedness of Inside Out to the bleakness of Requiem for a Dream.  However, several films share a thematic element of exploring complex relationships and the human condition.
response.list_B_description: List B presents a more cohesive selection of films, leaning towards science fiction, adventure, and drama. While there's variety in settings and specific plots (e.g., space, war, surrealism), the overall tone remains relatively consistent.  The inclusion of WALL-E and Little Miss Sunshine provides some tonal contrast, but the list is less dramatically diverse than List A.
response.list_C_description: List C shows a blend of genres, including science fiction (Avatar, Gravity), war (1917), drama (Intouchables), surrealism (Being John Malkovich), thriller (Shutter Island), and mystery (Knives Out).  The list is less tonally diverse than List A, with a slightly more serious and suspenseful overall feel.  However, the inclusion of WALL-E and Knives Out adds some unique elements.
response.comparison: List A stands out due to its wider range of genres and tones.  List B is more thematically consistent, while List C offers a good mix of genres but with a less varied tone than List A.  List A successfully balances diverse genres with contrasting emotional palettes, making it the most diverse.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A exhibits the greatest diversity because it encompasses a broader spectrum of genres (animation, thriller, sci-fi, drama, crime, dramedy) and tones (lighthearted, suspenseful, bleak, heartwarming).  The inclusion of outliers like Inside Out and Intouchables against darker films like Requiem for a Dream and Shutter Island enhances the overall diversity.

response.comparison: List A and List C both have a similar level of diversity, with a mix of genres but a clustering of similar films. response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List B is the most diverse because it includes a wider range of genres and tones. The inclusion of "Monsters, Inc." (animation) and "Iron Man 2" (superhero) significantly broadens the scope compared to the other lists, which have more thematic consistency. response.comparison: List A stands out for its broader range of genres and tones. response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A exhibits the greatest diversity in genre, tone, and theme.  It successfully balances heavier themes with lighter ones, and includes a wider variety of cinematic styles and storytelling approaches compared to the other lists.

response.list_C_description: List C demonstrates high diversity. It encompasses action (Spider-Verse, The Departed), fantasy (Matrix, Lord of the Rings), drama (Schindler's List), animation (Toy Story, Shrek 2), and a survival story (Cast Away). The variety in animation styles, tones, and genres makes this list stand out.
response.comparison: List A is moderately diverse but leans heavily towards action and fantasy. List B improves on this by adding dramatic elements, but List C surpasses both with its inclusion of animation, a survival story, and a broader range of tones and genres.  The inclusion of outliers like Cast Away and Toy Story significantly enhances the diversity of List C.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C exhibits the most diversity because it successfully blends multiple genres (action, fantasy, drama, animation), tones (serious, comedic, adventurous), and animation styles.
